newsitem.title: USA: U.S. tech stocks lifted by rally in semiconductors.
newsitem.headline: U.S. tech stocks lifted by rally in semiconductors.

text.p: U.S. technology stocks were broadly higher on Thursday as a rally in semiconductor shares spurred the group.
Traders said positive news from semiconductor leader Intel Corp and a two-day industry conference in New York focused investors' attention on semiconductor stocks.

Despite struggling in recent trading sessions, the news from Intel was a sign the fundamentals of leading technology companies remain strong, traders said. "The underlying tone is that it's not over in techland yet," said Arnie Owen, director of equities at Kaufman Brothers.

Intel said earlier Thursday that it lowered first quarter prices on some microprocessor lines while preserving prices on its higher-end Pentium Pro chips. Traders and analysts said the pruce cuts were small-than-anticipated.

Intel's share's were up 2-3/4 to 157-1/2 in morning trading. Among other chip and semiconductor equipment stocks, Micron Technology Inc gained 2-3/4 to 35-3/4, Texas Instruments Inc added 3-1/4 to 73, Applied Materials Inc rose one to 46-7/8 and Novellus Systems Inc rose 1-3/4 to 76-3/4.
The Philadelphia Stock Exchange's semiconductor index shot up over nine points, or 3.1 percent, to 280.

Expectations of upbeat news coming out of the investor conference hosted by Semiconductor Equipment Materials International, the industry's leading trade group, also supported semiconductor stocks, traders said.
They also said recent talk of possible South Korean memory chip production cuts favored the group.
Other bellwether technology stocks rose on Thursday. Microsoft Corp rose 1-3/4 to 99-1/8 and Cisco Systems Inc gained one to 67.
But computer makers did not participate in the rally amid investor concerns that their component costs, particularily chips, could be rising, traders said.
International Business Machines Corp sipped 1/4 at 156-1/5, Dell Computer Corp dropped 5/8 to 65 and Compaq Computer Corp eased 5/8 to 84-1/8.
